intro: Vicia flavida, commonly known as the yellow vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands, disturbed soils, and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. It has a climbing habit, using its tendrils to support itself on other plants or structures. Vicia flavida is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
